stories.text: Some people who have not English as mother tongue suffers from reading comprehension. It may be lack of practice, but in day to day life they encounter their mother language more often. This makes them to practice English hard.
stories.title: Are people who don't have English as mother tongue suffers from dislexia?

stories.text: I have Manjaro GNU/Linux installed on my laptop and it's serving me great. However, I find myself firing up a lot of virtual machines on VirtualBox (Kali for CTF's, Windows for experiments, Minikube for k8s, and more). I wonder if it is a good idea for me to install a type 1 hypervisor on my machine  in this case. Do you have any stories to share?
stories.title: Anyone who uses a type 1 hypervisor as a daily driver on laptop?
